thread.title: Pike stuns top-ranked North Central with comeback
thread.title_full: Pike stuns top-ranked North Central with comeback

author: IndyStar correspondent
title: Pike stuns top-ranked North Central with comeback
text:
Pike stuns top-ranked North Central with comeback Tom Moor, IndyStar correspondent Published 11:05   10 hours ago CLOSE x Share Pike comes from behind to beat North Central in overtime 61-59 in Saturday's girls basketball regional final. The Panthers, ranked No. 1, were unbeaten headed into the game. Clark Wade / IndyStar Buy Photo Pike coach Bob Anglea celebrates with the Regional Champions trophy and the game ball after winning the IHSAA 4A Girls' Basketball Tournament Regional championship game, Saturday. (Photo: Doug McSchooler/for IndyStar) Buy Photo 67 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
INDIANAPOLIS – The Pike girls basketball team was forced to sit out last season’s IHSAA state tournament, the result of a nasty on-court fight between rival Ben Davis. 
If there were any questions about how the Red Devils would respond this season, they were answered on Saturday night. A year later — with many of the same players on the court — Pike won, perhaps, its biggest game in program history and found itself just two wins away from a state title. 
Fourth-ranked Pike (23-3) used a second-half comeback — with the game-winner coming on a layup by junior guard Angel Baker in the final seconds — to stun top-ranked and undefeated North Central, 61-59, in overtime of the Class 4A Decatur Central regional final. 
It’s the first regional title in school history for the Red Devils, who advance to semistate to play Columbus North at either Richmond or Jeffersonville. 
North Central, which beat Pike twice in the regular season, finishes 27-1. 
“We talked about last season,” Pike coach Bob Anglea said. “We want to build a program, and (last year) was not who we were. These players needed love. It’s about family. I’m so proud of them. In my 12 years of coaching, this has been the most fun year.” Facebook A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Buy Photo North Central High School senior Ajanae’ Thomas (34) and Pike High School junior Angel Baker (15) battle for a loose ball during the second half of the IHSAA 4A Girls' Basketball Tournament Regional championship game, Saturday, Feb. 11, 2017, at Decatur Central High School. Pike won in overtime, 61-59. Doug McSchooler/for IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Pike High School junior Mariah Brown (23) slaps a shot by North Central High School into the backcourt during the first half of the IHSAA 4A Girls' Basketball Tournament Regional championship game, Saturday, Feb. 11, 2017, at Decatur Central High School. Doug McSchooler/for IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo North Central High School sophomore Rikki Harris (1) and Pike High School junior Michaela White (21) battle for a rebound during the second half of the IHSAA 4A Girls' Basketball Tournament Regional championship game, Saturday, Feb. 11, 2017, at Decatur Central High School. Pike won in overtime, 61-59. Doug McSchooler/for IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo The Pike High School bench erupts as the take the lead in the third quarter of the IHSAA 4A Girls' Basketball Tournament Regional championship game, Saturday, Feb. 11, 2017, at Decatur Central High School. Pike won in overtime, 61-59. Doug McSchooler/for IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Pike High School senior LaRae Rascoe (10) puts up a shot over the defense of North Central High School junior Taylor Ramey (11) during the second half of the IHSAA 4A Girls' Basketball Tournament Regional championship game, Saturday, Feb. 11, 2017, at Decatur Central High School. Pike won in overtime, 61-59. Doug McSchooler/for IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Pike High School junior Michaela White (21) looses control of the ball under the basket during the second half of the IHSAA 4A Girls' Basketball Tournament Regional championship game, Saturday, Feb. 11, 2017, at Decatur Central High School. Pike won in overtime, 61-59. Doug McSchooler/for IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Pike High School sophomore Jada Roberson (3) drives the ball toward the basket and is ultimately called for the offensive foul during the second half of the IHSAA 4A Girls' Basketball Tournament Regional championship game, Saturday, Feb. 11, 2017, at Decatur Central High School. Pike won in overtime, 61-59.
